repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
It's a function to perform operations in their own sealed context,
similar to pythons `with`. This helps ease operations where you need to
perform an operation in a specific context, and then restore the
context, among other things.

Marked as private for now as it's not ready for being publicized.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -14,3 +14,23 @@
 --- @param ... any
 --- @return any
 function vim.call(func, ...) end
+
+--- @class vim.context.mods
+--- @field sandbox? boolean
+--- @field noautocmd? boolean
+--- @field hide? boolean
+--- @field horizontal? boolean
+--- @field keepalt? boolean
+--- @field keepjumps? boolean
+--- @field keepmarks? boolean
+--- @field keeppatterns? boolean
+--- @field lockmarks? boolean
+---
+--- @field buf? integer
+--- @field win? integer
+
+--- @generic R1, R2, R3, R4
+--- @param mods vim.context.mods
+--- @param f fun(): R1, R2, R3, R4
+--- @return R1, R2, R3, R4
+function vim.__with(mods, f) end

comment_data.body: No, this is the function signature for the `vim.__with` function (that is defined in the C code) that is called in `vim._with` function. In hindsight maybe the naming isn't great lol

comment_data.body: I just changed the name to `_with_c` to avoid writing a comment instead

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
      vim.api.nvim_set_option_value(k, v, { scope = 'local', win = context.win, buf = context.buf })
```

I think this should take care of setting the properly scoped option values whenever `win/buf/neither` is passed? Same with `nvim_get_option_value`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1139,4 +1139,24 @@ function vim._defer_require(root, mod)
   })
 end
 
+--- @private
+function vim._with(context, f)
+  -- vim._with({ options = { isfname = vim.o.isfname .. ',@-@' } }, function() end)
+  local previous_options = {}
+  if context.options then
+    for k, v in pairs(context.options) do
+      previous_options[k] = vim.o[k]
+      vim.o[k] = v

comment_regular_data.body: TODO: write tests for lockmarks(?), buffer and options

title: feat(lua): add vim._with
